intro: Spatholirion puluongense, commonly known as the Puluong grass, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grass species. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
